thread.title: SouthWest Airlines flight turned back after man allegedly chokes woman for reclining her seat
thread.title_full: SouthWest Airlines flight turned back after man allegedly chokes woman for reclining her seat

author: Network writer
title: SouthWest Airlines flight turned back after man allegedly chokes woman for reclining her seat
text:
A Southwest Airlines flight was delayed after a passenger allegedly tried to choke another passenger over legroom.
Network writer News Corp Australia Network SOME people will do anything to get more leg room on a plane.
A passenger on a Southwest flight from Los Angeles to San Francisco allegedly started strangling another passenger after she reclined her seat.
The flight was turned around on Sunday night about 30 minutes into the journey when an argument over legroom turned violent, NBC Washington reports.
“Evidently, we’ve got two passengers who are in a physical altercation, so we need to get turned around back to LAX,” the pilot told air-traffic control in a radio transmission obtained by NBC News.
Southwest Airlines cited a “rapidly escalating situation between two passengers” who were not travelling together and said the FBI was now investigating the matter.
“Flight attendants swiftly coordinated with pilots on the flight deck to get the aircraft on the ground safely and quickly after a physical altercation by one passenger against another,” the airline said in a statement.
Witnesses reported the woman said a man sitting behind her tried to strangle her because she put her seat back, NBC News said.
The man’s alleged actions actually attracted empathy on Twitter:
Choking on #SouthwestAirlines is bad behavior, but a clear indication that airlines need to provide more personal space.
— John M Shelton (@ImpresarioReno) October 19, 2015 Lets be real - if you're over 5'8, you've thought about choking out the recliner in front of you. http://t.co/ckG1ChHA4Z #SouthwestAirlines
— Sabrina Z (@TheRealSabrinaZ) October 19, 2015 I mean, we've all been close to it before... http://t.co/lloAITcR3G
— Samantha Leigh (@samantha_eagan) October 19, 2015 Sadly, I can almost relate.... man grounds airplane for choking fellow passenger for reclining her seat https://t.co/t9sbMgTDET
— Maria-Christina (@mckolodziej) October 19, 2015 The unidentified man was detained by Los Angeles Airport Police, but no arrests have been made.
“An individual was detained for questioning following the return of a SW aircraft to LAX based on allegations of an assault involving a fellow passenger,” FBI Public Affairs Specialist Laura Eimiller said in a statement.
“No arrest has been made at this time and the investigation is continuing. The flight left for San Francisco shortly after midnight as I understand.”
The remaining passengers boarded another flight and arrived in San Francisco five hours late.
Originally published as Man ‘chokes’ woman for reclining seat
